title: Railway Lamb Curry (Railway Mutton Curry Style) — Foodie Fuel
method: Heat oven to 170°C (fan 150°C). Season lamb with a pinch of salt and black pepper.
Brown lamb in a casserole with oil for 6–8 minutes. Remove.
Cook onion 8 minutes until golden. Add garlic and ginger; cook 1 minute.
Stir in coriander, cumin and turmeric; cook 30 seconds. Add star anise, cardamom, tomato purée and tomatoes.
Return lamb, add stock, bring to a simmer. Cover and bake 55 minutes until tender.
Stir in spinach to wilt, then finish with lemon juice. Taste and season lightly. Rest 5 minutes.
plating: Spoon rice into a neat mound (use a small bowl to mould if you like).
Ladle curry beside the rice so the sauce sits glossy, not flooded.
Finish with coriander and a final crack of black pepper.
swaps: Use lean beef stewing steak if lamb is unavailable (same cooking time).
hydrationTip: Sparkling water with lime keeps the palate fresh with peppery sauces.

title: Kerala Pepper Prawns (Kuru Milagu Eral) — Foodie Fuel

ingredients.item: Raw king prawns, peeled and deveined

method: Heat a wide pan on medium-high. Add coconut oil, then onion; cook 6–7 minutes until soft and lightly browned.
Add garlic, ginger, curry leaves and green chilli; cook 1 minute until fragrant.
Stir in turmeric and black pepper. Add tomato and cook 3 minutes to a jammy base.
Add okra, cook 6–8 minutes until tender and lightly crisp at the edges.
Add prawns and cook 2–3 minutes, tossing, until just pink and opaque.
Finish with lime juice and coriander. Taste and season with a small pinch of salt.
plating: Pile okra and pepper base in the centre of warm bowls.
Arrange prawns on top so they stay plump and glossy.
Finish with extra curry leaves and a squeeze of lime at the table.
hydrationTip: Still water with cucumber works well with chilli heat.

title: Saag Paneer with Charred Spring Onions — Foodie Fuel
method: Heat a non-stick pan on medium-high. Sear paneer in rapeseed oil 3–4 minutes, turning, until golden. Set aside.
In the same pan cook onion 7 minutes until soft. Add garlic and ginger for 1 minute.
Add cumin, coriander and turmeric; toast 30 seconds.
Add spinach and kale with a splash of water; cook 4–5 minutes until collapsed.
Blend briefly for a textured purée (optional). Return to pan, add milk and garam masala; simmer 3 minutes.
Stir paneer through and warm 2 minutes. Finish with lemon juice.
Char spring onions in a dry pan 2 minutes; slice.
plating: Spoon saag into a shallow bowl.
Nestle paneer cubes and top with charred spring onion.
Finish with a squeeze of lemon.
hydrationTip: Sparkling water with lemon complements the greens.

title: Tandoori Cod with Ajwain, Mint Raita & Cabbage Kachumber — Foodie Fuel

ingredients.item: Kashmiri chilli powder (or mild chilli powder)

method: Heat oven to 220°C (fan 200°C). Line a tray.
Mix yoghurt, garlic, ginger, ajwain, coriander, turmeric, chilli and half the lemon juice. Season lightly.
Coat cod in the marinade and place on the tray. Roast 10–12 minutes until just flaky.
Make kachumber: toss cabbage, cucumber and tomato with vinegar, remaining lemon juice, half the mint and a pinch of salt. Rest 5 minutes.
Stir remaining mint into a spoon of yoghurt as a quick raita.
plating: Spoon cabbage kachumber into a tidy pile.
Set cod alongside and spoon a little mint raita over the fish.
Finish with a pinch of chilli powder and lemon wedge.
hydrationTip: Still water with mint keeps the palate cool.

title: Hyderabadi Chicken with Coconut, Coriander & Toasted Sesame — Foodie Fuel
method: Heat a pan on medium-high with oil. Brown chicken 6–8 minutes; remove.
Cook onion 8 minutes until golden. Add garlic and ginger for 1 minute.
Toast cumin, coriander, turmeric and chilli 30 seconds.
Return chicken, add coconut milk and 150 ml water. Simmer 20–25 minutes until cooked through.
Add beans for the last 6–7 minutes.
Finish with lime juice, coriander, toasted coconut and sesame.
plating: Spoon chicken and sauce into bowls.
Arrange beans neatly to one side.
Finish with sesame, coriander and lime wedge.
hydrationTip: Sparkling water with lime complements coconut and chilli.

title: Chettinad Pepper Chicken (Kozhi Milagu Varuval) — Foodie Fuel

ingredients.item: Skinless chicken thighs, boneless, cut into chunks

method: Heat a wide pan with oil. Cook onion 8 minutes until deep golden.
Add garlic, ginger, fennel and curry leaves; cook 1 minute.
Add chicken, season lightly, and sauté 8–10 minutes until browned.
Stir in pepper and coriander; cook 30 seconds. Add tomato and 100 ml water.
Cover and simmer 15 minutes, stirring once or twice. Add beans; cook 6–7 minutes.
Finish with lime juice and coriander. Reduce uncovered 2 minutes to a glossy coating.
plating: Pile beans and chicken neatly, keeping the masala clinging to the meat.
Finish with fresh coriander and a final crack of pepper.
Serve with lemon wedge and a crisp salad if desired.
swaps: Use turkey-free: swap chicken for lean diced pork tenderloin (shorten simmer by 5 minutes).
hydrationTip: Sparkling water with lime and a pinch of salt works well with pepper heat.

title: Bengali Mustard Fish (Shorshe Maach) — Foodie Fuel
method: Blitz mustard seeds with green chilli, turmeric and 3 tbsp water to a smooth paste.
Heat oil in a pan on medium. Add mustard paste and cook 2 minutes, stirring.
Add remaining water, bring to a gentle simmer.
Slide in fish, cover and poach 8–10 minutes until just flaky.
Blanch broccoli 2 minutes; drain and season with lime.
Finish the sauce with lime juice and coriander.
plating: Place broccoli as a base in shallow bowls.
Set fish on top and spoon mustard sauce over the centre.
Keep edges clean; finish with coriander and chilli slices.
swaps: Use salmon if you prefer; poach 7–8 minutes depending on thickness.
hydrationTip: Still water with lime calms the mustard heat.

title: Gujarati Undhiyu (Winter Vegetable & Bean Stew) — Foodie Fuel
method: Cook onion in oil 8 minutes until golden. Add garlic and ginger for 1 minute.
Toast cumin, coriander and turmeric 30 seconds.
Add sweet potato and stock; simmer covered 15 minutes.
Add aubergine, beans, cauliflower and chickpeas; simmer 20–25 minutes until tender.
Stir in garam masala and coconut; simmer 5 minutes to thicken.
Finish with lemon juice and coriander.
plating: Spoon into warm bowls and finish with coriander.
Add a small sprinkle of toasted coconut for texture.
Serve with a crisp cucumber salad for contrast.
swaps: Add paneer cubes for a vegetarian version (adds milk allergen).
hydrationTip: Still water with lemon is ideal with coconut-forward stews.

title: Goan Prawn Caldin (Coconut & Turmeric Curry) — Foodie Fuel
method: Cook onion and pepper in oil 8 minutes until soft.
Add garlic and ginger 1 minute. Toast cumin, coriander and turmeric 30 seconds.
Add tomato and cook 3 minutes. Pour in coconut milk and 150 ml water; simmer 8 minutes.
Add cavolo nero and cook 4 minutes.
Add prawns and cook 2–3 minutes until just pink. Finish with lime.
plating: Serve rice as a neat mound.
Ladle caldin around the rice so the broth stays vibrant.
Top with prawns and a squeeze of lime.
swaps: Use cod chunks instead of prawns (poach 6–8 minutes).
hydrationTip: Sparkling water with lime pairs with coconut and turmeric.

title: Amritsari Fish Tikka with Gram Flour Crust — Foodie Fuel

ingredients.item: Haddock or cod loin, cut into large cubes

method: Heat oven to 220°C (fan 200°C). Line a tray and brush lightly with oil.
Mix gram flour with ajwain, coriander, turmeric, chilli, lemon juice and enough water (about 90 ml) to make a thick batter. Season lightly.
Toss fish in batter, place on tray, drizzle oil, and roast 10–12 minutes until cooked through.
Mix yoghurt with mint and a squeeze of lemon for a quick dip.
Toss salad and cucumber with a pinch of salt and lemon.
plating: Pile salad on one side; arrange fish tikka neatly with browned edges visible.
Spoon mint yoghurt in a small swipe.
Finish with lemon wedge.
swaps: Air-fryer: 200°C for 9–10 minutes, turning once.
hydrationTip: Still water with mint cools chilli.

title: Dal Makhani (Lightened) with Black Lentils — Foodie Fuel
method: Cook onion in oil 8 minutes until golden. Add garlic and ginger 1 minute.
Toast cumin, coriander and turmeric 30 seconds. Stir in tomato purée 1 minute.
Add lentils, kidney beans and stock; simmer gently 35–40 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Stir in spinach to wilt. Take off heat and swirl through yoghurt and garam masala.
Finish with lime juice; season lightly.
plating: Spoon into warm bowls, finish with a yoghurt swirl and coriander if you have it.
Serve with cucumber salad to keep it light.
swaps: Add grilled chicken pieces for extra protein if desired.
hydrationTip: Still water with lime pairs with rich lentils.

title: Rajasthani Laal Maas (Lamb, toned heat) — Foodie Fuel
method: Brown lamb in oil 6–8 minutes. Remove.
Cook onion 8 minutes until golden. Add garlic and ginger 1 minute.
Toast chilli, cumin, coriander and turmeric 30 seconds. Add cinnamon and cloves.
Add tomatoes and stock, return lamb and simmer gently 60 minutes until tender.
Stir in cavolo nero for the last 6–7 minutes. Finish with lime and adjust seasoning.
plating: Spoon curry into bowls and keep sauce glossy (reduce uncovered 3 minutes if needed).
Finish with lime and a pinch of chilli powder.
swaps: Lower heat: halve chilli powder and add extra lime at the end.
hydrationTip: Still water with lemon works well with spiced dishes.

title: Kashmiri Rogan Josh (Tomato-free style) — Foodie Fuel
method: Brown lamb in a casserole 6–8 minutes; remove.
Cook onion 8 minutes. Add garlic and ginger 1 minute.
Toast cumin, coriander, paprika and turmeric 30 seconds.
Return lamb, add stock and simmer 55–60 minutes until tender.
Off the heat, whisk yoghurt with 2 tbsp hot sauce, then stir into the pot (prevents splitting).
Add spinach to wilt. Finish with lemon and season lightly.
plating: Spoon into warm bowls; finish with a yoghurt swirl and coriander if available.
Serve with a crisp salad rather than heavy bread.
swaps: Dairy-free: use coconut yoghurt (may add coconut flavour).
hydrationTip: Still water with lemon works well with spiced dishes.

title: Mangalorean Chicken Gassi — Foodie Fuel
method: Toast desiccated coconut in a dry pan 2 minutes until golden; set aside.
Brown chicken in oil 6–8 minutes; remove.
Cook onion 8 minutes. Add garlic and ginger 1 minute.
Toast spices 30 seconds. Add tomatoes and 150 ml water; simmer 10 minutes.
Return chicken and coconut; simmer 20 minutes until cooked through.
Add beans for last 6–7 minutes. Finish with lime.
plating: Serve with beans arranged neatly, chicken piled high, sauce glossy.
Finish with toasted coconut for texture.
swaps: Use prawns instead of chicken: add prawns in the last 3 minutes.
hydrationTip: Still water with lemon works well with spiced dishes.

title: Prawn & Coconut Moilee (Kerala) — Foodie Fuel
method: Cook onion in coconut oil 8 minutes until soft.
Add garlic and ginger 1 minute; stir in turmeric.
Add tomato, coconut milk and 150 ml water; simmer 8 minutes.
Add spinach to wilt, then prawns; cook 2–3 minutes until just pink.
Finish with lime and season lightly.
plating: Ladle moilee into bowls, place prawns on top, keep broth bright.
Finish with lime wedge.
swaps: Use cod chunks instead; poach 6–8 minutes.
hydrationTip: Still water with lemon works well with spiced dishes.

title: Kolkata Chingri Malai Curry (Lightened) — Foodie Fuel
method: Cook onion in oil 8 minutes. Add garlic and ginger 1 minute, stir in turmeric.
Add tomato and cook 3 minutes. Pour in coconut milk, milk and 150 ml water; simmer 10 minutes.
Add beans for 6–7 minutes.
Add prawns for the last 2–3 minutes.
Finish with lime and season lightly.
plating: Mould rice, spoon curry around, then place prawns neatly on top.
Keep finish clean; add lime wedge.
swaps: Dairy-free: replace milk with more coconut milk (richer).
hydrationTip: Still water with lemon works well with spiced dishes.

title: Paneer Tikka Masala (Roasted) — Foodie Fuel
method: Heat oven to 220°C (fan 200°C).
Mix yoghurt with chilli, cumin, coriander and turmeric. Coat paneer, pepper and onion; thread onto skewers.
Roast 12–14 minutes until charred at edges.
Meanwhile cook chopped onion 8 minutes with 1 tsp oil. Add garlic and ginger 1 minute.
Add tomatoes and garam masala; simmer 12 minutes, then blend for a smooth sauce if desired.
Stir in spinach to wilt. Add roasted paneer and veg; warm 2 minutes. Finish with lemon.
plating: Spoon sauce as a pool, arrange skewered paneer pieces on top.
Finish with coriander and a squeeze of lemon.
swaps: Vegan: swap paneer for firm tofu (adds soya allergen).
hydrationTip: Still water with lemon works well with spiced dishes.

title: Chana Masala with Roasted Cauliflower — Foodie Fuel
method: Heat oven to 220°C (fan 200°C). Toss cauliflower with oil, cumin, coriander, turmeric and paprika; roast 18–20 minutes until browned.
Cook onion 8 minutes in a pan with 2 tbsp water until soft. Add garlic and ginger 1 minute.
Add tomatoes, chickpeas and garam masala; simmer 12 minutes to thicken.
Stir in spinach to wilt, fold through roasted cauliflower, and finish with lemon.
plating: Spoon chana masala into bowls and crown with roasted cauliflower.
Finish with coriander and a lemon wedge.
swaps: Add a spoon of yoghurt on top for vegetarian (milk allergen).
hydrationTip: Sparkling water with lemon keeps it fresh.

title: Baingan Bharta (Smoky Aubergine Mash) — Foodie Fuel
method: Heat oven to 220°C (fan 200°C). Prick aubergines and roast 30–35 minutes until collapsed.
Scoop flesh into a bowl and mash.
Cook onion in oil 8 minutes. Add garlic and ginger 1 minute.
Toast cumin, coriander, turmeric and paprika 30 seconds.
Add tomatoes and lentils; simmer 10 minutes. Stir in aubergine and cook 5 minutes.
Finish with lemon and coriander.
plating: Spoon bharta into a shallow bowl with a slight swirl.
Top with coriander and lemon wedge.
swaps: Add grilled chicken on the side if you want more protein.
hydrationTip: Still water with lemon works well with spiced dishes.

title: Malabar Fish Curry with Tamarind — Foodie Fuel

ingredients.item: Salmon or cod, cut into large pieces

method: Cook onion in coconut oil 8 minutes. Add garlic and ginger 1 minute.
Add turmeric and chilli 30 seconds. Stir in tamarind and coconut milk plus 150 ml water; simmer 8 minutes.
Add beans for 6–7 minutes.
Add fish and simmer gently 6–8 minutes until just cooked.
Finish with lime and season lightly.
plating: Arrange fish pieces on top of the curry so they look intentional.
Serve with beans visible and a lime wedge.
swaps: Use cod for a lighter finish; reduce cooking to 5–6 minutes.
hydrationTip: Still water with lemon works well with spiced dishes.

title: Chicken Rezala (Yoghurt, Saffron & Cashew) — Foodie Fuel

ingredients.item: Cashews, soaked then blended with 80 ml water

method: Brown chicken in a pan 6–8 minutes; remove.
Cook onion 8 minutes. Add garlic and ginger 1 minute. Toast cumin, coriander and turmeric 30 seconds.
Return chicken with 150 ml water; simmer 20 minutes.
Lower heat. Stir in yoghurt (tempered with a spoon of sauce) and cashew cream. Simmer 5 minutes until glossy.
Add spinach to wilt. Finish with lemon. Add saffron if using.
plating: Spoon rezala into bowls, keep sauce glossy and pale.
Finish with a few saffron threads and coriander if available.
swaps: Nut-free: swap cashew cream for extra yoghurt (thinner but still rich).
hydrationTip: Still water with lemon works well with spiced dishes.

title: Lucknowi Galouti-Style Keema with Pea Salad — Foodie Fuel
method: Cook onion in oil 8 minutes. Add garlic and ginger 1 minute.
Add mince and cook 8–10 minutes, breaking up, until browned.
Toast cumin, coriander, turmeric and garam masala 30 seconds. Stir in tomato purée 1 minute.
Add 150 ml water; simmer 10 minutes to thicken. Stir in peas for final 3 minutes.
Mix cucumber and tomato with lemon and mint as a fresh salad.
plating: Spoon keema into a shallow bowl and top with the pea mixture.
Serve salad on the side for crunch and freshness.
swaps: Use lean beef mince if preferred.
hydrationTip: Still water with lemon works well with spiced dishes.

title: Sindhi Sai Bhaji (Spinach & Lentil Pot) — Foodie Fuel
method: Cook onion in oil 8 minutes. Add garlic and ginger 1 minute.
Toast cumin and turmeric 30 seconds. Add chickpeas and stock; simmer 10 minutes.
Add spinach and kale; simmer 8 minutes until tender.
Blend lightly for a thick, spoonable consistency (optional). Finish with lemon.
plating: Spoon sai bhaji over rice so the greens look lush.
Finish with lemon wedge.
swaps: Add a spoon of yoghurt for vegetarian version (milk allergen).
hydrationTip: Still water with lemon works well with spiced dishes.

title: Keralan Beetroot Thoran — Foodie Fuel
method: Heat coconut oil in a pan. Add mustard seeds; let them pop.
Add curry leaves and chilli 30 seconds.
Add beetroot and cumin; cook 10–12 minutes, stirring, until tender.
Stir in lentils and coconut; warm 2 minutes.
Finish with lime and a small pinch of salt.
plating: Serve as a bright mound with coconut visible on top.
Add lime wedge for sharpness.
swaps: If avoiding chilli, use black pepper instead.
hydrationTip: Still water with lemon works well with spiced dishes.

title: Peshawari Chapli Kebab (Pan-seared) — Foodie Fuel
method: Mix mince with egg, onion, tomato, garlic, ginger, spices and coriander. Season lightly.
Form 4 thin patties.
Heat a non-stick pan with oil. Cook patties 4–5 minutes per side until browned and cooked through (juices run clear).
Serve with cucumber dressed with lemon and a pinch of salt.
plating: Place cucumber salad first, then kebabs stacked slightly offset for height.
Finish with coriander and lemon wedge.
swaps: Use lean beef mince if preferred; cook time is the same.
hydrationTip: Still water with lemon works well with spiced dishes.
